ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 6-7 hours
4-8 hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: great
Very good

This was a great course, however all the assignments were given the second half of the class, so it got difficult to manage time. It would have been helpful, for example, if 3-4 weeks prior to the 15 page term paper being due to not have any other assignments.
Great course, great professor with various lecturers.

I enjoyed this course, and I felt like I did learn a lot about exposure assessment. I think the reading could be a lot at times (especially in the beginning of the course because there were so many lengthy book chapters). I also enjoyed when we had time to discuss the readings in class, I think that was a good way to ensure that we really understood what was going on. A lot of the assignments were due in the second half of the course, it might have been worth it to have one or two due in the first few weeks just so the work load was spaced out a bit!
Very instructive class addressing relevant and current issues.Timing of the various assignments could be improved, as almost all assignments are due during the second half of the semester.

I really enjoyed this course! The range of topics discussed was very interesting and well balanced and I felt that the homework assignments, particularly the article critiques did an excellent job of tieing the course topics together. I learned alot and found this to be one of the more interesting and useful courses that I've taken at YSPH so far.
Excellent course. sometimes readings were too long and detailed but in class teaching was excellent and covered all of the readings if we didnt manage to do them

Strengths: hands-on air monitoring activity! The class covered a range of topics from biomonitoring, to water quality, to air pollution. Most of the readings were very interesting.Weaknesses: It would have been nice to draw more direct comparisons between air/water exposure dynamics and dive further into how air/water movement/dynamics affect exposure.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brian Leaderer  he is nice
Instructor: Brian Leaderer  He is good teacher
Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Dr. Leaderer gave a good overview of assessing exposures and brought in many guest lecturers to share their expertise. He was very helpful and available to the students.
Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Great! Dr. Leaderer, is very knowledgeable and caring. Learn a lot from him.

Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Overall Dr. Leaderer was a great instructor, its clear that this is his area of expertise and for the most part he was able to answer all of our questions clearly and succinctly. We also had some great guest lecturers as well, with different areas of expertise who were for the most part pretty good as well.
Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Great lecturer, responsive to students. Expectation of assignments and assignment due dates could be made clearer.

Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Dr. Leaderer was a wonderful instructor. He was so well versed on the subject matter and have very interesting, well balanced lectures. I also enjoyed having the various guest lecturers that we did.
Instructor: Brian Leaderer  very helpful

Instructor: Brian Leaderer  Dr. Leaderer is clearly very knowledgeable, was very well spoken, and was very open to the needs of students. The class was an excellent learning environment, very comfortable to ask questions.The guest lectures were overall excellent. Yet the water lectures could have been much more advanced (I can't imagine there's anyone in the class who doesn't already know how to calculate an odds ratio).

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: great course
This is the most helpful class that I have taken so far at YSPH. This class really emphasizes applying information rather than memorization.
Yes definitely, for EHS exposure assessment is always pertinent and this class gives you a great foundation.

I think this class is useful to anyone interested in environmental health or assessing environmental exposures. I think I learned a lot about thinking critically about study design and exposure assessment and measurement. The workload is pretty standard, with a fair amount of writing including a term paper final project.
Good course, would recommend.
Excellent course. Appropriate help from teacher
Excellent, and I'd absolutely recommend it for students interested in exposure.
